info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 6 at 8:25PM CDT until April 8 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Nashville TN
info.description:
...The Flood Advisory is extended for the following rivers in Tennessee...
Richland Creek Above Pulaski affecting Giles County.
For the Richland Creek...including Pulaski...elevated river levels are forecast.
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...Richland Creek above Pulaski.
* WHEN...Until early Tuesday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 20 feet, Water begins to inundate agricultural land along the river, as well as recreational areas including the Annie Wade Boat Ramp, Jim Potts Boat Ramp, and Vales Mill Boat Ramp. Water approaches Old Campbellsville Rd, Milky Way Rd near Hwy 31, Annie Wade Rd, and Vales Mill Rd near Chicken Creek Rd.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM CDT Sunday the stage was 19.5 feet and falling. - Forecast...The river is expected to crest at 18.0 feet this afternoon. - Action stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
Monday afternoon at 230 PM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TUESDAY MORNING
